text: Develop Arctic specific innovative ideas, platforms,and opportunities to harmonize and strengthen regional systems will significantly contribute to effectively manage climate change and its impact on the health of the Arctic. The health impacts of climate change in the Arctic are real and expanding. While adopting a One Health transdisciplinary approach represents a major paradigm shift, many short-term opportunities exist for quick wins despite limited resources. An incremental approach following the innovation maxim ''Think big, start small, scale fast'' has the potential for significant sustained health benefits for the Arctic into the future.
